verses.roman:
tabe mahāprabhu uṭhi' kailā ācamana
paṇḍita ānila, mukhavāsa, mālya, candana

synonyms: tabe—at that time; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; uṭhi'-getting up; kailā ācamana—performed washing of the hands and mouth; paṇḍita—Jagadānanda Paṇḍita; ānila—brought; mukha-vāsa—spices; mālya—flower garland; candana—sandalwood pulp.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu stood up and washed His hands and mouth, while Jagadānanda Paṇḍita brought spices, a garland, and sandalwood pulp.
